newsitem.title: FRANCE: Three small bomb attacks in Corsican capital.
newsitem.headline: Three small bomb attacks in Corsican capital.

text.p: Suspected Corsican separatist guerrillas detonated three small bombs in the island's capital Ajaccio before dawn on Saturday, causing slight damage but no casualties, police said.
Their targets were the main post office, an Air France agency and a tax office, police said.
Employees of the post office went on strike to protest against the attack, which shattered the main glass door of their building, and said they would return to work only on Monday.

Several clandestine separatist groups, some suspected by police of also being deeply involved in racketeering, have been active on the island for over a decade, regularly detonating explosive devices outside government offices late at night to avoid casualties.
